newsitem.title: USA: Execs may seek proxies for Universal slate.
newsitem.headline: Execs may seek proxies for Universal slate.

text.p: Two Texas-based executives said they holds a 5.17 percent stake in Universal Seismic Associates Inc and may seek shareholder proxies to elect its own slate of directors of the company.

Michael Kanarellis, president of Technoflex Inc, a Houston-based marketing services firm and Robert Kecseg, an analyst at Irving, Texas,-based First Research Financial Inc, said they have agreed to act as a group in light of Universal's deteriorating financial and stock performance.
The executives hold 263,000 common shares in Universal, a Houston-based oil exploration services company.

The executives said they are "dissatisfied" with the company for its apparent failure to carry out a complete review of a letter of intent for the company to merge with Suelopetrol C.A., of Venezuela.
Such a failure, they said, has "seriously jeopardized" the likelihood the merger would go through. The merger, they said, "is essential for the company's future viability."

The executives said they are considering seeking a court order to compel the Universal board to call an annual meeting of shareholders. It said it may also seek a call for a special meeting to remove at least a majority of the current board members.
If they succeed in replacing the board, they would recommend that the company resume negotiations with Suelopetrol and seek to complete a deal with the Venezuelan company on favorable terms.
